jobs.title: Tech Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At MyEdSpace, we find the best teachers on the planet and empower them to become the most inspiring, tech-enabled educators, able to reach the students who need them most – wherever they are, whatever their means.

Because we believe that every child deserves access to quality education, regardless of geography or socioeconomic background, to achieve their dreams and build a brighter future.

We achieve this by combining top teaching talent with cutting-edge technology, delivering engaging lessons and offering meaningful support to students and their families.

Our vision is ambitious: to revolutionize education, empower millions of students globally, and provide high-quality learning opportunities that transform lives.

We have just completed our Series A from top-tier investors and are ready to scale - we want you to lead the charge with us.

If you’re a top-performer, incredibly ambitious, and excited to redefine an industry on a societal level and make a real impact on the world - we’d love to hear from you.

The Practical Bits

Job Title: Tech Lead

Manager: VP of Engineering

Location: We are open to candidates being based within +/- 3 hours GMT

Contract Type: Permanent employee or employer of record (depending on location)

Salary: Highly competitive + bonus upside

The Role

We’re looking for a Tech Lead who cares deeply about building great products and well-structured systems - whether your strengths lie in backend, frontend, or across the stack. You’ll guide technical decisions, help navigate trade-offs, and support engineers in delivering high-quality work.

Beyond hands-on contributions, you'll play a key role in shaping a collaborative engineering culture rooted in technical depth, product thinking, and thoughtful design. We're building both the system and the team that will take us to the next stage, and you'll have real influence on how we scale, structure, and evolve our technology.

Who We're Looking For

  • Strong backend engineering background, PHP or Java, with the ability to design, build, and maintain scalable services. Familiarity with React.js or similar modern frontend frameworks is a bonus.

  • Senior engineering experience in product-led, fast-paced environments - ideally with time spent leading teams or large projects.

  • Strong software architecture skills - API-first, modular design, async comms, scaling patterns.

  • Fluency in Agile and Lean methodologies, with a pragmatic approach to process and change.

  • Comfortable working in Docker-based, cloud-native environments (we use AWS).

  • A track record of shipping user-facing products that are performant, elegant, and thoughtfully engineered.

  • Excellent communication skills and collaborative mindset - you're comfortable working across disciplines and time zones.

  • Excited by the potential of AI and LLMs to transform learning.

  • A builder’s mindset - you bias toward action, care about craft, and love iterating toward better outcomes.

  • Bonus: Experience with education platforms or familiarity with the UK/US education systems

What You'll Do

  • Lead and mentor a globally distributed team of engineers, fostering a high-performance, inclusive, and collaborative culture.

  • Set the bar for technical excellence, promoting best practices across architecture, CI/CD, testing, and code quality.

  • Drive a DevOps mindset - engineers own what they build, from design to deployment and beyond.

  • Architect and deliver scalable, maintainable systems and features with measurable impact on learners.

  • Partner cross-functionally with product, design, and data to shape roadmap, scope work, and align on outcomes.

  • Continuously improve how we build software - from delivery speed and reliability to team workflows and technical decision-making.

Our Hiring Process

  1. CV Screening

    We review your experience, technical foundation, and alignment with the role.

  2. Introductory Call with Hiring Manager

    A 45-60 minute conversation to discuss your background, what you're looking for, and how we work.

  3. Coding Exercise

    A take-home or live session designed to assess practical skills — architecture, clean code, testing, and problem-solving.

  4. Technical Interview

    A deep dive into your engineering approach — we’ll explore past projects, technical decisions, and systems thinking.

  5. Culture & Collaboration Interview

    A final conversation to assess team fit, communication style, and alignment with our values and ways of working.

Note: You may choose to do a pair programming exercise. In that case, steps 3 and 4 will be combined

✨ Our values

PUT INTEGRITY FIRST Honesty matters. Tell the truth, and be straight-up. Be transparent and do the right thing. This builds respect and reliability for our students, families and team members.

KNOW YOUR COORDINATES Understand where you are and where you want to get to. Know your strengths and acknowledge your gaps. Think from first principles. Question things, and never pretend to know what you don't.

RAISE THE BAR Own it and get it done. Do better. Iterate quickly and seek feedback. Deliver real value. Be excellent and lift others up. Share learnings and help your teammates improve.

LOVE TO BE WRONG Push boundaries. Be outside your comfort zone. Naturally you'll get some things wrong and that's okay. Embrace feedback. Learn from it and get closer to excellence.

WIN TOGETHER To achieve our mission, we have to work together. We all have a role to play, so help each other get there. We’re stronger as a team so inspire, support and respect each other.

🙋 Why you’ll love working here

We’re a team on a mission to transform education for the better. Joining MES means you’ll be part of something ambitious, fast-moving, and full of purpose. Here’s what you can expect:

  • The chance to make a real impact: your work directly shapes the future of education.

  • A fast-paced and high-growth environment where ideas move quickly and careers accelerate.

  • A collaborative, supportive culture: we’re head quartered in the UK, but we’re a global team with colleagues in 15+ countries, bringing a rich mix of perspectives and energy.

 4. Technical Interview

 5. Culture & Collaboration Interview

Note: You may choose to do a pair programming exercise. In that case, steps 3 and 4 will be combined

✨ Our values

PUT INTEGRITY FIRST Honesty matters. Tell the truth, and be straight-up. Be transparent and do the right thing. This builds respect and reliability for our students, families and team members.

KNOW YOUR COORDINATES Understand where you are and where you want to get to. Know your strengths and acknowledge your gaps. Think from first principles. Question things, and never pretend to know what you don't.

RAISE THE BAR Own it and get it done. Do better. Iterate quickly and seek feedback. Deliver real value. Be excellent and lift others up. Share learnings and help your teammates improve.

LOVE TO BE WRONG Push boundaries. Be outside your comfort zone. Naturally you'll get some things wrong and that's okay. Embrace feedback. Learn from it and get closer to excellence.

WIN TOGETHER To achieve our mission, we have to work together. We all have a role to play, so help each other get there. We’re stronger as a team so inspire, support and respect each other.

🙋 Why you’ll love working here

We’re a team on a mission to transform education for the better. Joining MES means you’ll be part of something ambitious, fast-moving, and full of purpose. Here’s what you can expect:

 - The chance to make a real impact: your work directly shapes the future of education.

 - A fast-paced and high-growth environment where ideas move quickly and careers accelerate.

 - A collaborative, supportive culture: we’re head quartered in the UK, but we’re a global team with colleagues in 15+ countries, bringing a rich mix of perspectives and energy.

jobs.title: People Operations Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At MyEdSpace, we find the best teachers on the planet and empower them to become the most inspiring, tech-enabled educators, able to reach the students who need them most – wherever they are, whatever their means.

Because we believe that every child deserves access to quality education, regardless of geography or socioeconomic background, to achieve their dreams and build a brighter future.

We achieve this by combining top teaching talent with cutting-edge technology, delivering engaging lessons and offering meaningful support to students and their families.

Our vision is ambitious: to revolutionize education, empower millions of students globally, and provide high-quality learning opportunities that transform lives.

We have just completed our Series A from top-tier investors and are ready to scale - we want you to lead the charge with us.

If you’re a top-performer, incredibly ambitious, and excited to redefine an industry on a societal level and make a real impact on the world - we’d love to hear from you.

💼 The Role:

We have a new role to join our new People Team!

We’re looking for a People Operations Manager who blends operational excellence with curiosity, systems-thinking, and a passion for people experience.

This isn’t a traditional HR role, it’s a design, automation, and transformation role.

Reporting to the Chief of Staff, as part of a small People Function that is establishing itself, you’ll be hands-on in execution while helping to shape the future of how we work and grow globally. We’re a complex team with circa 50 People UK based (mostly in London) and then a mix of circa 120 EoRs, CoRs and Contractors globally, with people in about 15 different countries. We’re also expanding our product to the US in 2026. There’s lots happening!

⚙️ What you’ll do

No day is ever the same. Given you’ll be coming from a similar environment, in a global high growth series A startup, you’ll know that adaptability is key. However your main responsibilities will include:

  • Own and optimise the employee lifecycle from onboarding to offboarding, ensuring a world-class experience that reflects our values at every step.

  • Automate and streamline people processes using modern HR tools, data, and AI-driven insights.

  • Champion our HRIS & ATS systems maintain data accuracy, integrations, and reporting to power better decision-making - we’re using Deel & Ashby.

  • Design people experiences as products thinking in terms of end users, touchpoints, and outcomes.

  • Partner cross-functionally with Finance, Operations, and Leadership to ensure scalability, compliance, and clarity as we grow globally.

  • Support and in some instances own, transformation projects org design changes, leadership enablement, and new process rollouts.

  • Analyse and report on key people metrics (e.g., engagement, retention, hiring efficiency) to drive continuous improvement.

🙋 Who we’re looking for

You know what good looks like. You will have worked at a high growth, founder led, global startup and implemented a number of foundational, scalable practices and process before, for both People & Talent. You have a natural inclination to always want to make things better and more efficient. You think about a tech-first solutions, rather than throwing people at the problem. You’re:

  • An executioner with vision - able to balance big-picture thinking with getting things done brilliantly.

  • Tech-forward and data fluent - confident using (and experimenting with) HR tech, automation tools, and AI to improve workflows.

  • Obsessed with user experience - you design processes that feel seamless and human for employees and managers alike.

  • Analytical and detail-oriented - accuracy and insight go hand in hand in your work.

  • Change-ready - and thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment and enjoys building structure where there isn’t any yet.

  • Collaborative and trusted - you build credibility with stakeholders and partners to enable decisions, not block them.

  • Curious and continuous learner - always looking for better, smarter, simpler ways of doing things.

  • Proactive and pragmatic - happy to push things through, know when to ask for help, understand the trade-offs between tactical and strategic solutions.

🔩 Details:

  • Location: Chancery Lane (3-4 days per week)

  • Reporting to: Chief of Staff

  • Salary: £45-£60k pa

✨ Our values

PUT INTEGRITY FIRST Honesty matters. Tell the truth, and be straight-up. Be transparent and do the right thing. This builds respect and reliability for our students, families and team members.

KNOW YOUR COORDINATES Understand where you are and where you want to get to. Know your strengths and acknowledge your gaps. Think from first principles. Question things, and never pretend to know what you don't.

RAISE THE BAR Own it and get it done. Do better. Iterate quickly and seek feedback. Deliver real value. Be excellent and lift others up. Share learnings and help your teammates improve.

LOVE TO BE WRONG Push boundaries. Be outside your comfort zone. Naturally you'll get some things wrong and that's okay. Embrace feedback. Learn from it and get closer to excellence.

WIN TOGETHER To achieve our mission, we have to work together. We all have a role to play, so help each other get there. We’re stronger as a team so inspire, support and respect each other.

🙋 Why you’ll love working here

We’re a team on a mission to transform education for the better. Joining MES means you’ll be part of something ambitious, fast-moving, and full of purpose. Here’s what you can expect:

  • The chance to make a real impact: your work directly shapes the future of education.

  • A fast-paced and high-growth environment where ideas move quickly and careers accelerate.

  • A collaborative, supportive culture: we’re head quartered in the UK, but we’re a global team with colleagues in 15+ countries, bringing a rich mix of perspectives and energy.

✨ Our values

PUT INTEGRITY FIRST Honesty matters. Tell the truth, and be straight-up. Be transparent and do the right thing. This builds respect and reliability for our students, families and team members.

KNOW YOUR COORDINATES Understand where you are and where you want to get to. Know your strengths and acknowledge your gaps. Think from first principles. Question things, and never pretend to know what you don't.

RAISE THE BAR Own it and get it done. Do better. Iterate quickly and seek feedback. Deliver real value. Be excellent and lift others up. Share learnings and help your teammates improve.

We’re a team on a mission to transform education for the better. Joining MES means you’ll be part of something ambitious, fast-moving, and full of purpose. Here’s what you can expect:

compensationTiers.tierSummary: Based salary, plus bonus £45K – £60K • Offers Bonus

jobs.title: Lead Practitioner of Biology
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At MyEdSpace, we find the best teachers on the planet and empower them to become the most inspiring, tech-enabled educators, able to reach the students who need them most – wherever they are, whatever their means.

Because we believe that every child deserves access to quality education, regardless of geography or socioeconomic background, to achieve their dreams and build a brighter future.

We achieve this by combining top teaching talent with cutting-edge technology, delivering engaging lessons and offering meaningful support to students and their families.

Our vision is ambitious: to revolutionize education, empower millions of students globally, and provide high-quality learning opportunities that transform lives.

We have just completed our Series A from top-tier investors and are ready to scale - we want you to lead the charge with us.

If you’re a top-performer, incredibly ambitious, and excited to redefine an industry on a societal level and make a real impact on the world - we’d love to hear from you.

Step into the future of education as MyEdSpace's dedicated Biology Teacher for Key Stages 3, 4 and 5. This position is a full-time role with ~6-12 lessons delivered per week.

Differences vs. A Traditional Teaching Role?

Like a normal teaching role, you will be responsible for designing and delivering your subject’s curriculum via interactive lessons, multiple times per week. We just do this via online live streams instead of in person.

Here’s the twist… We turn you into an educational influencer on social media. For context, our Maths teacher currently has over 2.4 million social media followers. As such, you will be a leading face of the company and need to be comfortable building this online presence. You will partake in marketing efforts, including building social media content and being featured in adverts to promote MyEdSpace and your course. You will report directly to our Founding Team.

If you’re excited to change from a traditional school environment to a startup, where you can use technology to make a larger-scale impact, we want to hear from you!

Your Responsibilities:

  • Plan and deliver engaging online lessons via live streams - interact with your class and answer questions as they arise

  • Prepare all course materials including full curriculum plans, lesson plans, presentations and homeworks etc

  • Create engaging educational content for social media (we will help at every step of the way, don’t worry)

  • Collaborate with our Marketing Team on innovative ad campaigns

  • Communicate with students and parents to refine our services

  • Support our Co-Founders in various other company initiatives

Ideally, You:

  • Hold a degree (or higher) in Biology or a related field, achieving a 2:1 or above

  • Achieved top grades at A-level, achieving A/A* in your subject at A-level

  • Are willing to work in London (we are willing to consider a hybrid working model for outstanding candidates)

  • Are a dedicated and hardworking individual

  • Have a minimum of 5 years teaching experience and QTS.

  • Have experience teaching OCR/ AQA biology at A-level

  • Authorised to work in the United Kingdom

  • Are willing to develop your personal brand on social media - we will help and give you all the tools needed to succeed but you have to be comfortable with the idea of becoming an influencer

  • Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills

  • Is driven to develop personally, contributing to a transformative educational venture

✨ Our values

PUT INTEGRITY FIRST Honesty matters. Tell the truth, and be straight-up. Be transparent and do the right thing. This builds respect and reliability for our students, families and team members.

KNOW YOUR COORDINATES Understand where you are and where you want to get to. Know your strengths and acknowledge your gaps. Think from first principles. Question things, and never pretend to know what you don't.

RAISE THE BAR Own it and get it done. Do better. Iterate quickly and seek feedback. Deliver real value. Be excellent and lift others up. Share learnings and help your teammates improve.

LOVE TO BE WRONG Push boundaries. Be outside your comfort zone. Naturally you'll get some things wrong and that's okay. Embrace feedback. Learn from it and get closer to excellence.

WIN TOGETHER To achieve our mission, we have to work together. We all have a role to play, so help each other get there. We’re stronger as a team so inspire, support and respect each other.

🙋 Why you’ll love working here

We’re a team on a mission to transform education for the better. Joining MES means you’ll be part of something ambitious, fast-moving, and full of purpose. Here’s what you can expect:

  • The chance to make a real impact: your work directly shapes the future of education.

  • A fast-paced and high-growth environment where ideas move quickly and careers accelerate.

  • A collaborative, supportive culture: we’re head quartered in the UK, but we’re a global team with colleagues in 15+ countries, bringing a rich mix of perspectives and energy.

jobs.title: Backend Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At MyEdSpace, we find the best teachers on the planet and empower them to become the most inspiring, tech-enabled educators, able to reach the students who need them most – wherever they are, whatever their means.

Because we believe that every child deserves access to quality education, regardless of geography or socioeconomic background, to achieve their dreams and build a brighter future.

We achieve this by combining top teaching talent with cutting-edge technology, delivering engaging lessons and offering meaningful support to students and their families.

Our vision is ambitious: to revolutionize education, empower millions of students globally, and provide high-quality learning opportunities that transform lives.

We have just completed our Series A from top-tier investors and are ready to scale - we want you to lead the charge with us.

If you’re a top-performer, incredibly ambitious, and excited to redefine an industry on a societal level and make a real impact on the world - we’d love to hear from you.

The Practical Bits

Job Title: Backend Software Engineer

Location: Remote / flexible (we are open to candidates being based in the UK, or in Europe (+/- 2 hours GMT))

Contract Type: Permanent employee or employer of record (depending on location)

Salary: Competitive + bonus

Experience: 4+ years commercial experience as a Software Engineer

The Role

We’re hiring engineers who care about building great products and well-structured systems — whether your strengths lie in backend, frontend, or both. You can go deep in your specialty or work across the stack — what matters is your ability to reason about problems, make smart trade-offs, and collaborate well.

You’ll help shape a collaborative engineering culture grounded in technical depth, product thinking, and thoughtful design. We’re building both the system and the team that will take us to the next stage — and you’ll have a real say in how we get there.


What We’re Looking For

  • Strong backend engineering background, PHP or Java, with experience building and maintaining production-grade software (we’re open to all levels — what matters is the impact you’ve had)

  • A product-engineering mindset: you care about why something is built, not just how

  • Solid grasp of software design: modular systems, clean abstractions, thoughtful trade-offs

  • Familiarity with asynchronous processing, eventual consistency, and how to design for failure

  • A strong commitment to testing, quality, and writing code that others can understand and build on

  • Clear communication skills and a collaborative approach — we work in a remote-first, async-friendly environment

  • You’ve worked in modern development environments — version control, CI/CD pipelines, Docker-based setups, and cloud platforms like AWS are familiar territory

  • You thrive in an iterative environment where fast feedback, continuous learning, and course correction are part of the process — not signs of failure

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Design and build robust, maintainable product features — from backend APIs to frontend interactions

  • Collaborate closely with product and design to shape and deliver user-facing functionality

  • Write code that’s clear, testable, and built with long-term maintainability in mind

  • Contribute to architectural discussions and help define technical direction as we scale

  • Participate in code reviews, pair programming, and shared decision-making

  • Own your work beyond shipping: you’ll help monitor, improve, and support what you build

  • Contribute to the performance, reliability, and security of the system as it grows

Our Hiring Process

We aim to keep the process efficient, transparent, and focused on mutual fit.

  1. CV Screening

    Your application will be reviewed by one of our engineers to assess your technical foundation, relevant experience, and overall alignment with the role.

  2. Screening Call

    A short conversation to get to know each other better.

    You’ll learn more about MyEdSpace and how we work, while we’ll explore what motivates you, how you like to collaborate, and whether our ways of working align.

  3. Coding Exercise

    A take-home coding challenge designed to assess practical engineering skills — architecture, clean code, testing, and problem-solving.

    Alternatively, it’s your call: you can choose to do a pair programming exercise instead. In that case, it will be merged with the technical interview, and the combined step will take a bit longer.

  4. Technical Interview

    A deep dive into your engineering approach — exploring past projects, technical decisions, and systems thinking. This session is typically joined by two engineers (or a Tech Lead and the Hiring Manager).

  5. Culture & Collaboration Interview

    A closing conversation to ensure strong alignment with our values and ways of working.

✨ Our values

PUT INTEGRITY FIRST Honesty matters. Tell the truth, and be straight-up. Be transparent and do the right thing. This builds respect and reliability for our students, families and team members.

KNOW YOUR COORDINATES Understand where you are and where you want to get to. Know your strengths and acknowledge your gaps. Think from first principles. Question things, and never pretend to know what you don't.

RAISE THE BAR Own it and get it done. Do better. Iterate quickly and seek feedback. Deliver real value. Be excellent and lift others up. Share learnings and help your teammates improve.

LOVE TO BE WRONG Push boundaries. Be outside your comfort zone. Naturally you'll get some things wrong and that's okay. Embrace feedback. Learn from it and get closer to excellence.

WIN TOGETHER To achieve our mission, we have to work together. We all have a role to play, so help each other get there. We’re stronger as a team so inspire, support and respect each other.

🙋 Why you’ll love working here

We’re a team on a mission to transform education for the better. Joining MES means you’ll be part of something ambitious, fast-moving, and full of purpose. Here’s what you can expect:

  • The chance to make a real impact: your work directly shapes the future of education.

  • A fast-paced and high-growth environment where ideas move quickly and careers accelerate.

  • A collaborative, supportive culture: we’re head quartered in the UK, but we’re a global team with colleagues in 15+ countries, bringing a rich mix of perspectives and energy.

 - Familiarity with asynchronous processing, eventual consistency, and how to design for failure

 - You’ve worked in modern development environments — version control, CI/CD pipelines, Docker-based setups, and cloud platforms like AWS are familiar territory

 - You thrive in an iterative environment where fast feedback, continuous learning, and course correction are part of the process — not signs of failure

 - Design and build robust, maintainable product features — from backend APIs to frontend interactions

 - Collaborate closely with product and design to shape and deliver user-facing functionality

 - Write code that’s clear, testable, and built with long-term maintainability in mind

 - Contribute to architectural discussions and help define technical direction as we scale

 - Participate in code reviews, pair programming, and shared decision-making

 - Own your work beyond shipping: you’ll help monitor, improve, and support what you build

 - Contribute to the performance, reliability, and security of the system as it grows


OUR HIRING PROCESS

We aim to keep the process efficient, transparent, and focused on mutual fit.

 1. CV Screening
    
    Your application will be reviewed by one of our engineers to assess your technical foundation, relevant experience, and overall alignment with the role.

 2. Screening Call
    
    A short conversation to get to know each other better.
    
    You’ll learn more about MyEdSpace and how we work, while we’ll explore what motivates you, how you like to collaborate, and whether our ways of working align.

 3. Coding Exercise
    
    A take-home coding challenge designed to assess practical engineering skills — architecture, clean code, testing, and problem-solving.
    
    Alternatively, it’s your call: you can choose to do a pair programming exercise instead. In that case, it will be merged with the technical interview, and the combined step will take a bit longer.

 4. Technical Interview
    
    A deep dive into your engineering approach — exploring past projects, technical decisions, and systems thinking. This session is typically joined by two engineers (or a Tech Lead and the Hiring Manager).

 5. Culture & Collaboration Interview
    
    A closing conversation to ensure strong alignment with our values and ways of working.

✨ Our values

PUT INTEGRITY FIRST Honesty matters. Tell the truth, and be straight-up. Be transparent and do the right thing. This builds respect and reliability for our students, families and team members.

KNOW YOUR COORDINATES Understand where you are and where you want to get to. Know your strengths and acknowledge your gaps. Think from first principles. Question things, and never pretend to know what you don't.

RAISE THE BAR Own it and get it done. Do better. Iterate quickly and seek feedback. Deliver real value. Be excellent and lift others up. Share learnings and help your teammates improve.

LOVE TO BE WRONG Push boundaries. Be outside your comfort zone. Naturally you'll get some things wrong and that's okay. Embrace feedback. Learn from it and get closer to excellence.

WIN TOGETHER To achieve our mission, we have to work together. We all have a role to play, so help each other get there. We’re stronger as a team so inspire, support and respect each other.

🙋 Why you’ll love working here

We’re a team on a mission to transform education for the better. Joining MES means you’ll be part of something ambitious, fast-moving, and full of purpose. Here’s what you can expect:

 - The chance to make a real impact: your work directly shapes the future of education.

 - A fast-paced and high-growth environment where ideas move quickly and careers accelerate.

 - A collaborative, supportive culture: we’re head quartered in the UK, but we’re a global team with colleagues in 15+ countries, bringing a rich mix of perspectives and energy.

jobs.title: MarTech Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At MyEdSpace, we find the best teachers on the planet and empower them to become the most inspiring, tech-enabled educators, able to reach the students who need them most – wherever they are, whatever their means.

Because we believe that every child deserves access to quality education, regardless of geography or socioeconomic background, to achieve their dreams and build a brighter future.

We achieve this by combining top teaching talent with cutting-edge technology, delivering engaging lessons and offering meaningful support to students and their families.

Our vision is ambitious: to revolutionize education, empower millions of students globally, and provide high-quality learning opportunities that transform lives.

We have just completed our Series A from top-tier investors and are ready to scale - we want you to lead the charge with us.

If you’re a top-performer, incredibly ambitious, and excited to redefine an industry on a societal level and make a real impact on the world - we’d love to hear from you.

The Role

This is a role for someone who loves both engineering and growth. You’ll own attribution pipelines end-to-end, making sure every conversion is tied back to the right campaign, and enabling the growth team to scale with confidence.

You will report into the VP of Marketing, working side by side with performance marketers to ensure clean attribution and actionable data.

Responsibilities

  • Build and manage server-side event tracking across Meta, Google, and TikTok Ads.

  • Integrate HubSpot (CRM), Stripe, and Shopify into ad attribution pipelines.

  • Set up data flows from backend → GTM → analytics/ad platforms.

  • Debug and validate event flows to ensure clean data.

  • Partner with marketing to design experiments and measure outcomes.

  • Work closely with product/engineering to scope event tracking requirements.

Requirements

  • Hands-on experience connecting backend events into ad platforms.

  • Strong technical background (APIs, GTM, JavaScript, event architecture).

  • Solid experience with HubSpot, Stripe, and Shopify integrations.

  • Proven work at a startup, where you owned tracking independently.

  • Experience with GA4 and server-side GTM setups.

  • Bonus: SQL and BI tools (Looker Studio, Metabase, etc.).

✨ Our values

PUT INTEGRITY FIRST Honesty matters. Tell the truth, and be straight-up. Be transparent and do the right thing. This builds respect and reliability for our students, families and team members.

KNOW YOUR COORDINATES Understand where you are and where you want to get to. Know your strengths and acknowledge your gaps. Think from first principles. Question things, and never pretend to know what you don't.

RAISE THE BAR Own it and get it done. Do better. Iterate quickly and seek feedback. Deliver real value. Be excellent and lift others up. Share learnings and help your teammates improve.

LOVE TO BE WRONG Push boundaries. Be outside your comfort zone. Naturally you'll get some things wrong and that's okay. Embrace feedback. Learn from it and get closer to excellence.

WIN TOGETHER To achieve our mission, we have to work together. We all have a role to play, so help each other get there. We’re stronger as a team so inspire, support and respect each other.

🙋 Why you’ll love working here

  • The chance to make a real impact: your work directly shapes the future of education.

  • A fast-paced and high-growth environment where ideas move quickly and careers accelerate.

  • A collaborative, supportive culture: we’re head quartered in the UK, but we’re a global team with colleagues in 15+ countries, bringing a rich mix of perspectives and energy.

jobs.title: MyEdSpace Teacher
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At MyEdSpace, we find the best teachers on the planet and empower them to become the most inspiring, tech-enabled educators, able to reach the students who need them most – wherever they are, whatever their means.

Because we believe that every child deserves access to quality education, regardless of geography or socioeconomic background, to achieve their dreams and build a brighter future.

We achieve this by combining top teaching talent with cutting-edge technology, delivering engaging lessons and offering meaningful support to students and their families.

Our vision is ambitious: to revolutionize education, empower millions of students globally, and provide high-quality learning opportunities that transform lives.

We have just completed our Series A from top-tier investors and are ready to scale - we want you to lead the charge with us.

If you’re a top-performer, incredibly ambitious, and excited to redefine an industry on a societal level and make a real impact on the world - we’d love to hear from you.

Step into the future of education as a Teacher at MyEdSpace. We are always on the lookout for the UK's best Teachers to come and join us so, if that's you, please read on!

Differences vs. A Traditional Teaching Role?

Like a normal teaching role, you will be responsible for designing and delivering your subject’s curriculum via interactive lessons, multiple times per week. We just do this via online live streams instead of in person.

Here’s the twist… We turn you into an educational influencer on social media. For context, our Maths teacher currently has over 2.4 million social media followers. As such, you will be a leading face of the company and need to be comfortable building this online presence. You will partake in marketing efforts, including building social media content and being featured in adverts to promote MyEdSpace and your course.

If you’re excited to change from a traditional school environment to a startup, where you can use technology to make a larger-scale impact, we want to hear from you!

Your Responsibilities:

  • Plan and deliver engaging online lessons via live streams - interact with your class and answer questions as they arise

  • Prepare all course materials including full curriculum plans, lesson plans, presentations and homeworks etc

  • Create engaging educational content for social media (we will help at every step of the way, don’t worry)

  • Collaborate with our Marketing Team on innovative ad campaigns

  • Communicate with students and parents to refine our services

  • Support our Co-Founders in various other company initiatives

Ideally, You:

  • Hold a degree (or higher) in Biology or a related field, achieving a 2:1 or above

  • Achieved top grades at A-level, achieving A/A* in your subject at A-level

  • Are willing to work in London 1-2 days a week (we are willing to consider alternate working models for outstanding candidates)

  • Are a dedicated and hardworking individual

  • Have a minimum of 5 years teaching experience and QTS.

  • Have experience teaching from 11+ to A-level

  • Authorised to work in the United Kingdom

  • Are willing to develop your personal brand on social media - we will help and give you all the tools needed to succeed but you have to be comfortable with the idea of becoming an influencer

  • Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills

  • Is driven to develop personally, contributing to a transformative educational venture

✨ Our values

PUT INTEGRITY FIRST Honesty matters. Tell the truth, and be straight-up. Be transparent and do the right thing. This builds respect and reliability for our students, families and team members.

KNOW YOUR COORDINATES Understand where you are and where you want to get to. Know your strengths and acknowledge your gaps. Think from first principles. Question things, and never pretend to know what you don't.

RAISE THE BAR Own it and get it done. Do better. Iterate quickly and seek feedback. Deliver real value. Be excellent and lift others up. Share learnings and help your teammates improve.

LOVE TO BE WRONG Push boundaries. Be outside your comfort zone. Naturally you'll get some things wrong and that's okay. Embrace feedback. Learn from it and get closer to excellence.

WIN TOGETHER To achieve our mission, we have to work together. We all have a role to play, so help each other get there. We’re stronger as a team so inspire, support and respect each other.

🙋 Why you’ll love working here

We’re a team on a mission to transform education for the better. Joining MES means you’ll be part of something ambitious, fast-moving, and full of purpose. Here’s what you can expect:

  • The chance to make a real impact: your work directly shapes the future of education.

  • A fast-paced and high-growth environment where ideas move quickly and careers accelerate.

  • A collaborative, supportive culture: we’re head quartered in the UK, but we’re a global team with colleagues in 15+ countries, bringing a rich mix of perspectives and energy.

jobs.title: Frontend Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At MyEdSpace, we find the best teachers on the planet and empower them to become the most inspiring, tech-enabled educators, able to reach the students who need them most – wherever they are, whatever their means.

Because we believe that every child deserves access to quality education, regardless of geography or socioeconomic background, to achieve their dreams and build a brighter future.

We achieve this by combining top teaching talent with cutting-edge technology, delivering engaging lessons and offering meaningful support to students and their families.

Our vision is ambitious: to revolutionize education, empower millions of students globally, and provide high-quality learning opportunities that transform lives.

We have just completed our Series A from top-tier investors and are ready to scale - we want you to lead the charge with us.

If you’re a top-performer, incredibly ambitious, and excited to redefine an industry on a societal level and make a real impact on the world - we’d love to hear from you.

The Practical Bits

Job Title: Frontend Software Engineer

Location: Remote / Flexible (we are open to candidates being based in the UK, or in Europe (+/- 3 hours GMT))

Contract Type: Permanent employee or employer of record (depending on location)

Salary: Competitive + bonus

Experience: 4+ years commercial experience as a Software Engineer

The Role

We’re hiring frontend engineers who care deeply about building great products and thoughtful user experiences. Whether you're focused on UI performance, design systems, or frontend architecture, what matters is your ability to reason about problems, make smart trade-offs, and collaborate well across disciplines.

You’ll help shape a collaborative engineering culture grounded in technical depth, product thinking, and a high bar for design quality. We’re building both the system and the team that will take us to the next stage — and you’ll have a real say in how we get there.

What We’re Looking For

  • Strong experience building and maintaining modern web applications in React

  • A product mindset: you care about usability, UX details, and how things feel in the hands of users

  • Solid grasp of software design: modular components, clean abstractions, thoughtful trade-offs

  • Comfort working with TypeScript, component libraries, state management patterns, and RESTful APIs

  • Familiarity with frontend testing practices (unit, integration, end-to-end)

  • Clear communication skills and a collaborative approach — we work in a remote-first, async-friendly environment

  • Experience with version control, CI/CD pipelines, and Docker-based dev environments

  • A bias toward shipping value, gathering feedback, and improving continuously

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Design and implement polished, performant user interfaces in React

  • Work closely with design and product to shape intuitive, accessible user experiences

  • Build reusable components, design systems, and frontend architecture that scale

  • Write clear, testable, and maintainable code — with long-term quality in mind

  • Participate in code reviews, pair programming, and shared technical decision-making

  • Own your work beyond the PR: help monitor, improve, and support the features you build

  • Contribute to frontend performance, reliability, and security as our system grows

Our Hiring Process

We aim to keep the process efficient, transparent, and focused on mutual fit.

  1. CV Screening

    Your application will be reviewed by one of our engineers to assess your technical foundation, relevant experience, and overall alignment with the role.

  2. Screening Call

    A short conversation to get to know each other better.

    You’ll learn more about MyEdSpace and how we work, while we’ll explore what motivates you, how you like to collaborate, and whether our ways of working align.

  3. Coding Exercise

    A take-home coding challenge designed to assess practical engineering skills — architecture, clean code, testing, and problem-solving.

    Alternatively, it’s your call: you can choose to do a pair programming exercise instead. In that case, it will be merged with the technical interview, and the combined step will take a bit longer.

  4. Technical Interview

    A deep dive into your engineering approach — exploring past projects, technical decisions, and systems thinking. This session is typically joined by two engineers (or a Tech Lead and the Hiring Manager).

  5. Culture & Collaboration Interview

    A closing conversation to ensure strong alignment with our values and ways of working.

✨ Our values

PUT INTEGRITY FIRST Honesty matters. Tell the truth, and be straight-up. Be transparent and do the right thing. This builds respect and reliability for our students, families and team members.

KNOW YOUR COORDINATES Understand where you are and where you want to get to. Know your strengths and acknowledge your gaps. Think from first principles. Question things, and never pretend to know what you don't.

RAISE THE BAR Own it and get it done. Do better. Iterate quickly and seek feedback. Deliver real value. Be excellent and lift others up. Share learnings and help your teammates improve.

LOVE TO BE WRONG Push boundaries. Be outside your comfort zone. Naturally you'll get some things wrong and that's okay. Embrace feedback. Learn from it and get closer to excellence.

WIN TOGETHER To achieve our mission, we have to work together. We all have a role to play, so help each other get there. We’re stronger as a team so inspire, support and respect each other.

🙋 Why you’ll love working here

We’re a team on a mission to transform education for the better. Joining MES means you’ll be part of something ambitious, fast-moving, and full of purpose. Here’s what you can expect:

  • The chance to make a real impact: your work directly shapes the future of education.

  • A fast-paced and high-growth environment where ideas move quickly and careers accelerate.

  • A collaborative, supportive culture: we’re head quartered in the UK, but we’re a global team with colleagues in 15+ countries, bringing a rich mix of perspectives and energy.
jobs.descriptionPlain:
At MyEdSpace, we find the best teachers on the planet and empower them to become the most inspiring, tech-enabled educators, able to reach the students who need them most – wherever they are, whatever their means.

Because we believe that every child deserves access to quality education, regardless of geography or socioeconomic background, to achieve their dreams and build a brighter future.

We achieve this by combining top teaching talent with cutting-edge technology, delivering engaging lessons and offering meaningful support to students and their families.

Our vision is ambitious: to revolutionize education, empower millions of students globally, and provide high-quality learning opportunities that transform lives.

We have just completed our Series A from top-tier investors and are ready to scale - we want you to lead the charge with us.

If you’re a top-performer, incredibly ambitious, and excited to redefine an industry on a societal level and make a real impact on the world - we’d love to hear from you.


THE PRACTICAL BITS

Job Title: Frontend Software Engineer

Location: Remote / Flexible (we are open to candidates being based in the UK, or in Europe (+/- 3 hours GMT))

Contract Type: Permanent employee or employer of record (depending on location)

Salary: Competitive + bonus

Experience: 4+ years commercial experience as a Software Engineer


THE ROLE

We’re hiring frontend engineers who care deeply about building great products and thoughtful user experiences. Whether you're focused on UI performance, design systems, or frontend architecture, what matters is your ability to reason about problems, make smart trade-offs, and collaborate well across disciplines.

You’ll help shape a collaborative engineering culture grounded in technical depth, product thinking, and a high bar for design quality. We’re building both the system and the team that will take us to the next stage — and you’ll have a real say in how we get there.

What We’re Looking For

 - Strong experience building and maintaining modern web applications in React

 - A product mindset: you care about usability, UX details, and how things feel in the hands of users

 - Solid grasp of software design: modular components, clean abstractions, thoughtful trade-offs

 - Comfort working with TypeScript, component libraries, state management patterns, and RESTful APIs

 - Familiarity with frontend testing practices (unit, integration, end-to-end)

 - Clear communication skills and a collaborative approach — we work in a remote-first, async-friendly environment

 - Experience with version control, CI/CD pipelines, and Docker-based dev environments

 - A bias toward shipping value, gathering feedback, and improving continuously

What You’ll Be Doing

 - Design and implement polished, performant user interfaces in React

 - Work closely with design and product to shape intuitive, accessible user experiences

 - Build reusable components, design systems, and frontend architecture that scale

 - Write clear, testable, and maintainable code — with long-term quality in mind

 - Participate in code reviews, pair programming, and shared technical decision-making

 - Own your work beyond the PR: help monitor, improve, and support the features you build

 - Contribute to frontend performance, reliability, and security as our system grows





OUR HIRING PROCESS

We aim to keep the process efficient, transparent, and focused on mutual fit.

 1. CV Screening
    
    Your application will be reviewed by one of our engineers to assess your technical foundation, relevant experience, and overall alignment with the role.

 2. Screening Call
    
    A short conversation to get to know each other better.
    
    You’ll learn more about MyEdSpace and how we work, while we’ll explore what motivates you, how you like to collaborate, and whether our ways of working align.

 3. Coding Exercise
    
    A take-home coding challenge designed to assess practical engineering skills — architecture, clean code, testing, and problem-solving.
    
    Alternatively, it’s your call: you can choose to do a pair programming exercise instead. In that case, it will be merged with the technical interview, and the combined step will take a bit longer.

 4. Technical Interview
    
    A deep dive into your engineering approach — exploring past projects, technical decisions, and systems thinking. This session is typically joined by two engineers (or a Tech Lead and the Hiring Manager).

 5. Culture & Collaboration Interview
    
    A closing conversation to ensure strong alignment with our values and ways of working.

✨ Our values

PUT INTEGRITY FIRST Honesty matters. Tell the truth, and be straight-up. Be transparent and do the right thing. This builds respect and reliability for our students, families and team members.

KNOW YOUR COORDINATES Understand where you are and where you want to get to. Know your strengths and acknowledge your gaps. Think from first principles. Question things, and never pretend to know what you don't.

RAISE THE BAR Own it and get it done. Do better. Iterate quickly and seek feedback. Deliver real value. Be excellent and lift others up. Share learnings and help your teammates improve.

LOVE TO BE WRONG Push boundaries. Be outside your comfort zone. Naturally you'll get some things wrong and that's okay. Embrace feedback. Learn from it and get closer to excellence.

WIN TOGETHER To achieve our mission, we have to work together. We all have a role to play, so help each other get there. We’re stronger as a team so inspire, support and respect each other.

🙋 Why you’ll love working here

We’re a team on a mission to transform education for the better. Joining MES means you’ll be part of something ambitious, fast-moving, and full of purpose. Here’s what you can expect:

 - The chance to make a real impact: your work directly shapes the future of education.

 - A fast-paced and high-growth environment where ideas move quickly and careers accelerate.

 - A collaborative, supportive culture: we’re head quartered in the UK, but we’re a global team with colleagues in 15+ countries, bringing a rich mix of perspectives and energy.

jobs.title: Sales Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At MyEdSpace, we find the best teachers on the planet and empower them to become the most inspiring, tech-enabled educators, able to reach the students who need them most – wherever they are, whatever their means.

Because we believe that every child deserves access to quality education, regardless of geography or socioeconomic background, to achieve their dreams and build a brighter future.

We achieve this by combining top teaching talent with cutting-edge technology, delivering engaging lessons and offering meaningful support to students and their families.

Our vision is ambitious: to revolutionize education, empower millions of students globally, and provide high-quality learning opportunities that transform lives.

We have just completed our Series A from top-tier investors and are ready to scale - we want you to lead the charge with us.

If you’re a top-performer, incredibly ambitious, and excited to redefine an industry on a societal level and make a real impact on the world - we’d love to hear from you.

The practical bits

Job Title: Sales Manager

Manager: Founders Associate

Location: Remote

Contract Type: Contractor

Fixed Rate: $800 / month + commission

The role

We're looking for hungry, commission-driven sales professionals to help families transform their children's education through our online tutoring programs. You’ll be calling warm leads (they’ve clicked our ads) and closing sales for educational packages ranging from $99-$649.

This is not a customer service role - we need closers who love the thrill of winning deals and hitting targets.

What you'll do

  • Close warm leads - Convert parents who've clicked our ads into paying customers through consultative phone sales conversations

  • Pitch tailored tutoring packages - Present our educational programs ($99-$649) by understanding each family's needs and matching them with the right solution

  • Own your sales pipeline - Manage follow-ups, overcome objections, and drive deals to completion while maintaining accurate CRM records

  • Hit ambitious monthly targets - Consistently meet and exceed lead conversion goals to maximise your commission earnings

  • Represent our mission - Act as the voice of MyEdSpace, building trust with families and demonstrating how we can transform their children's educational outcomes

Who we're looking for

  • 2+ years of sales experience, preferably in the UK or US market

  • Strong phone-based sales skills

  • C1/C2 English proficiency

  • A proven track record of closing deals, not just handling inbound enquiries

  • Reliable home office setup - computer (8GB+ RAM), headset with mic, stable wired internet

✨ Our values

PUT INTEGRITY FIRST Honesty matters. Tell the truth, and be straight-up. Be transparent and do the right thing. This builds respect and reliability for our students, families and team members.

KNOW YOUR COORDINATES Understand where you are and where you want to get to. Know your strengths and acknowledge your gaps. Think from first principles. Question things, and never pretend to know what you don't.

RAISE THE BAR Own it and get it done. Do better. Iterate quickly and seek feedback. Deliver real value. Be excellent and lift others up. Share learnings and help your teammates improve.

LOVE TO BE WRONG Push boundaries. Be outside your comfort zone. Naturally you'll get some things wrong and that's okay. Embrace feedback. Learn from it and get closer to excellence.

WIN TOGETHER To achieve our mission, we have to work together. We all have a role to play, so help each other get there. We’re stronger as a team so inspire, support and respect each other.

🙋 Why you’ll love working here

We’re a team on a mission to transform education for the better. Joining MES means you’ll be part of something ambitious, fast-moving, and full of purpose. Here’s what you can expect:

  • The chance to make a real impact: your work directly shapes the future of education.

  • A fast-paced and high-growth environment where ideas move quickly and careers accelerate.

  • A collaborative, supportive culture: we’re head quartered in the UK, but we’re a global team with colleagues in 15+ countries, bringing a rich mix of perspectives and energy.
